alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 11:36PM CDT until September 22 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas, including the following county, Phillips. Portions of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Franklin, Harlan and Kearney. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one half inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Minden, Alma, Franklin, Orleans, Hildreth, Wilcox, Campbell, Stamford, Republican City, Upland, Naponee, Bloomington, Riverton, Huntley, Norman and Harlan County Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
